outputValidation.content:
{
  "problem_id": "P05",
  "final_answer": {
    "value": 0.889,
    "units": "g",
    "precision_note": "Current and time are given to 3 significant figures, so the final mass of copper is stated to 3 significant figures."
  },
  "method": "First, calculate the total electrical charge passed using Q = I * t. Convert the time to seconds: 30.0 min * 60 = 1800 s. Then, Q = 1.50 A * 1800 s = 2700 C. Next, calculate the moles of electrons transferred by dividing the charge by the Faraday constant (96,500 C mol-1), yielding 0.02798 mol of electrons. The half-equation Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu shows that 2 moles of electrons deposit 1 mole of copper, so moles of Cu = 0.02798 / 2 = 0.01399 mol. Finally, multiply by the atomic mass of Cu (63.55) to find the mass: 0.01399 mol * 63.55 g/mol = 0.889 g.",
  "key_equations": [
    "Q = I * t",
    "n(e-) = Q / F",
    "m = n * Mr"
  ],
  "line_refs": [
    "L19",
    "L24",
    "L51",
    "L52"
  ],
  "checks": [
    "Converted minutes to seconds correctly.",
    "Divided moles of electrons by 2 based on the half-equation stoichiometry."
  ]
}
